response: "Why does everyone expect me to be perfect all the time? It's like I can never make a mistake without feeling judged."
"I feel like I'm losing myself in this constant pursuit of perfection. It's exhausting and I don't even know who I am anymore."
"Everywhere I look, there are images of flawless people. It's making me question my own worth and appearance."
"I can't help but compare myself to others, and it's driving me crazy. I constantly feel like I'm never good enough."
"The pressure to excel in every aspect of my life is suffocating. I wish I could just take a break and breathe."
"I'm starting to doubt my abilities and talents because I'm constantly comparing myself to others who seem to have it all figured out."
"It feels like society has set impossible standards for me to live up to. How can I ever meet these expectations?"
"I'm afraid to show any vulnerability because I fear it will be seen as weakness. I'm constantly pretending to be strong, even when I'm falling apart inside."
"I'm starting to question my own worth because I'm not achieving the same level of success as those around me. Am I destined to be a failure?"
"I don't understand why everyone is so obsessed with appearances and fitting into a specific mold. It's driving me insane trying to conform to these unrealistic standards."
